discussion.p: remove_filename() specifies !has_filename() as the post condition. This post condition is not correct. For example the path "/foo" has a filename of "foo". If we remove the filename we get "/", and "/" has a filename of "/".
discussion.note: 17 Jun 2014 Rapperswil LWG will investigate issue at a subsequent meeting.

note.b: Apr 2016 Issue updated to address the C++ Working Paper. Previously addressed File System TS

discussion.p: There was concern that the effects wording is not right. Jonathan provided updated wording.

p.ins: Effects: *this = parent_path(), except that if parent_path() == root_path(), clear().

blockquote.pre: std::cout << path("/foo").remove_filename(); // outputs "/" std::cout << path("/").remove_filename(); // outputs ""

p.ins: Effects: If *this == root_path(), then clear(). Otherwise, *this = parent_path().

blockquote.p:
[Example:
std::cout << path("/foo").remove_filename(); // outputs "/" std::cout << path("/").remove_filename(); // outputs ""
